item.title: Hunting PrivateLoader: Pay-Per-Install Service
item.description: PrivateLoader, as the name indicates, is a malware loader first seen in early 2021. It’s part of a pay-per-install malware distribution service that has been used to distribute info stealers, banking trojans, other loaders, and even ransomware, on machines running windows. The payloads are selectively delivered to victims based on location, financial activity, environment, and specific software installed. It has been seen hosted on websites that claim to provide cracked software.

item.title: FluBot Persists: Infecting Europe and Australia
Backdoors Pre-Installed on Cheap Android Devices
Fraudulent Ads SDK Installed On 15 Million Android Devices
About
item.description: Hello! My name is André. I’m from Portugal and currently a Cyber Threat Intelligence Researcher at BitSight, experienced on tracking crimeware malware, including its network infrastructure and distribution campaigns, through malware analysis, reverse engineering, and threat intelligence.
